fields.summary: Namenode report bad block method doesn't check whether the block belongs to datanode before adding it to corrupt replicas map.

This message was automatically generated.

Attaching a new patch addressing white space and find bugs warnings.
TestBlockManager passes on my local box on both jdk versions.
Failure of TestHFlush is being tracked under multiple jiras: HDFS-2043, HDFS-3041 and HDFS-4504
TestDataNodeLifeline is failing on local box with and without my patch.
But I don't see it failing on any other jenkins build except this one.
I will wait for another jenkins build on my latest patch.
If it fails again then I will file a jira.

This message was automatically generated.

All the failing tests except TestHFlush passed on my machine with jdk7 and jdk8.
There are several jiras tracking TestHFlush failing tests.

The logic around this code is dicey.  There are some odd edge cases surrounding {{storageInfo#addBlock}}.  A client can report a corrupt GS that's different than currently in the blocks map.  I question if the those should be ignored.  Or more importantly, if the client reports a storage different than the NN expects, the NN decides to move the block to the client reported storage.

I'll file another jira for the seemingly odd behavior of immediately invalidating a block if reported corrupt with a younger GS, forgetting it's corrupt or even exists on the DN, DN ignoring the invalidate because the GS is wrong, DN eventually sending BR with the forgotten block.

bq. There are some odd edge cases surrounding storageInfo#addBlock. A client can report a corrupt GS that's different than currently in the blocks map. I question if the those should be ignored.
Created HDFS-10770
